items.title: Bradley will 'never get over' US Ryder Cup defeat
items.summary: Team USA captain Keegan Bradley says he has endured "one of the toughest times" of his life since their Ryder Cup defeat by Europe.

items.title: 'Infectious and resilient' - NI's latest teen star Moore
items.summary: New Northern Ireland call-up Mia Moore is "resilient" and "infectious", says her captain at league champions Glentoran, Jess Foy.

items.title: 'Tough feedback' - how Frankfurt turned Ekitike into Â£69m star
items.summary: Hugo Ekitike arrived at Eintracht Frankfurt having fallen out of favour at PSG, he left for Liverpool 18 months later as a Â£69m star forward.

items.title: The first major OnePlus 15 price leak has encouraging news
items.summary: The OnePlus 15 might be a little cheaper in at least one major market.
items.body: Credit: Weibo/Li Jie Louis TL;DR A leaker has claimed that the 512GB OnePlus 15 will retail for Â£949 (~$1,270) in the UK. That would be a little cheaper than the launch price for the 512GB OnePlus 13 in the region. Thereâ€™s no word on pricing for the base OnePlus 15 model, though. Weâ€™ve already seen a host of OnePlus 15 leaks ahead of its Chinese launch next week, while OnePlus itself has also confirmed a few specs and features. Now, a tipster has dished out the first major price-related leak for this flagship Android phone . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: All Blacks 'a brotherly rivalry' for Gibson-Park
items.summary: Ireland scrum-half Jamison Gibson-Park says that facing New Zealand feels like a "brotherly rivalry".

items.title: All Blacks 'a brotherly rivalry' for Gibson-Park

items.title: Thunder begin title defence with overtime win
items.summary: Last season's MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scores the winning points deep into overtime as champions Oklahoma City Thunder start their title defence with a victory.

items.title: Life at Wrexham by the unsung hero who has seen it all
items.summary: Over more than two decades, Geraint Parry has witnessed first-hand Wrexham's rise from financial crisis to global name

items.title: From foster care to Champions League - Kelly 'just getting started'
items.summary: Lloyd Kelly is set to line up for Juventus against Real Madrid in the Champions League, and the Englishman says he has "come a long way" from growing up in foster care.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy XR makes its official and expensive debut
items.summary: The era of Android XR begins with Samsung's Galaxy XR headset.
items.body: https://youtu.be/yOGuy0zCfwQ TL;DR Samsung has officially announced its new Galaxy XR device. All apps built on Android will work on the extended reality headset. Galaxy XR is available today for $1,799.99. Itâ€™s an extra $249.99 if you want the travel case or controllers. After all of this time, itâ€™s hard to believe that Samsung first began teasing its extended reality (XR) headset â€” Galaxy XR â€” in early 2023. Since then, the tech giant has drip-fed us information about the device, with occasional glimpses at the actual hardware peppered in. Today, all that waiting pays off as the company makes it official and launches the Galaxy XR in the US. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Galaxy XR early adopters can score up to $1,000 in freebies
items.summary: The "Explorer Pack" contains a host of subscriptions and XR content, taking some of the sting out the device's price tag.
items.body: https://youtu.be/yOGuy0zCfwQ TL;DR Early Galaxy XR buyers get an â€œExplorer Packâ€ worth up to $1,000. The bundle includes perks such as Google AI Pro, YouTube TV, and NBA League Pass. It also includes a bundle of specialized XR games and content, but you have to purchase the device before the end of the year to get it. Is the Galaxy XR expensive? Yes. Is it frustrating that you have to pay an additional $500 to add both the controllers and the travel case? Also yes. However, at least it didnâ€™t arrive with the same $3,499 price tag as the Apple Vision Pro, and we had always known it wouldnâ€™t be exactly cheap. If youâ€™re on the fence about throwing down the best part of $2,000 or more, this hefty dent in your bank balance can at least come with a multi-part silver lining, as early adopters of the device can score an â€œExplorer Packâ€ worth as much as $1,000. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Samsung Galaxy XR hands-on: Just the opening act
items.summary: Project Moohan is now a real product, but did it need to be one?
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yOGuy0zCfwQ For nearly a year, Samsung has been hyping up a new XR headset, previously known as Project Moohan . Now, finally, we know everything there is to know about the device, which is officially called the Samsung Galaxy XR. Itâ€™s the product of a massive collaboration between Samsung, Google, and Qualcomm, and itâ€™s packed with impressive tech. I got to spend some time with the device at Samsungâ€™s New York City launch event last week, and I want to say something a little unexpected, something I noticed after testing it. While Samsung clearly wants to sell as many of these as possible â€” it is a business chasing profit, after all â€” it was also made clear to me at the keynote that the well-known Apple Vision Pro sales failure is hanging heavy over this launch. In fact, this is one of the few launches Iâ€™ve ever been to in which the presenters actively told us that this product is â€œjust the beginningâ€ and that better things are on the way.

items.title: Google Fi is improving audio quality, bill summaries, and more for its first â€˜Feature Revealâ€™
items.summary: Google Fi is also offering a new promotion.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google Fi Wireless is expanding Wi-Fi Auto Connect Plus to millions of locations. When youâ€™re talking to someone on a landline or older device, your call will now use AI-enhanced audio to clean up background noise and clarify voices. Your monthly bills will now offer personalized AI-powered summaries to explain charges. Wish it were easier to stay up-to-date on the latest changes to Google Fi ? The company has announced that itâ€™s launching â€œFeature Reveals,â€ which are regular updates to help keep you informed. In the debut of Feature Reveals, Google shared that four changes are on the way, and itâ€™s rolling out a new promotion. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Googleâ€™s latest Android Canary is finally available for the entire Pixel family
items.summary: Come for the fun new flashlight UI, stay for the three-button navigation overhaul.
items.body: TL;DR Android Canary 2510 is available now for the Pixel 6 and newer hardware. Changes include a new UI for flashlight brightness control. Androidâ€™s been working on new options for three-button navigation, and this release finally lets us change the order. This year has probably been the most exciting one in at least a decade for Android fans who really like to get down into the trenches when it comes to software development, with Google giving them access to a new Android Canary track for bleeding-edge changes. Since debuting this past summer, Googleâ€™s consistently been bringing us a new Canary release each month, and today follows through with its very latest. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android now lets you flip your Pixelâ€™s navigation buttons, just like on Samsung Galaxy phones
items.summary: Android has finally added a setting to change the order of the buttons in the three-button navigation bar.
items.body: TL;DR Google is adding a new setting to Android that lets you reorder the three-button navigation bar. This will allow users to switch from the default â€œBack, Home, Recentsâ€ layout to the â€œRecents, Home, Backâ€ layout common on Samsung phones. The feature is live in the latest Android Canary build and may roll out to the public in the Android 16 QPR3 release. If youâ€™ve grown accustomed to using the three-button navigation bar on a Samsung phone , then you might have a hard time switching to a Google phone . Thatâ€™s because Samsung uses a different layout for its version of the three-button navigation bar. Instead of putting the back button on the left like on stock Android, Samsung puts the back button on the right. While Samsung does let you flip the order of these buttons to match stock Androidâ€™s layout, the opposite isnâ€™t true. Stock Android doesnâ€™t let you flip these buttons, so people switching from Samsung phones have to either retrain their muscle memory on the new button layout or switch to gesture navigation. To make it easier for Samsung users to switch to Pixel phones, Google is introducing a new Android setting that lets you reorder the buttons in the three-button navigaâ€¦

items.title: Pixel phones will get a smarter always-on display that saves battery life
items.summary: New code suggests Android will be able to turn off the display automatically when there's no user activity.
items.body: TL;DR Google is working on a new setting that gives Pixel users more control over the Always-on Display. This new option will automatically power down the display when no user activity is detected, helping save battery life. The feature isnâ€™t live yet, and itâ€™s unclear exactly how Android will determine when the phone is inactive. At the cost of some battery life, your phoneâ€™s always-on display (AOD) feature lets you see the time and new notifications at a glance. While most Android phones have an AOD, it doesnâ€™t behave the same way on every device. Some phones let you schedule the AOD to benefit from its glanceable information without unnecessarily draining the battery. Pixel phones , however, offer no such controls â€” the AOD is either on or off during the day. Fortunately, Google is working on a new setting that will soon give Pixel users more control over this feature. items.title: Get a 4-pack of Apple AirTag trackers at a record-low price
items.summary: These just saved me from a crisis last night!
items.body: Credit: Eric Zeman / Android Authority Do you keep losing your belongings? I swear it just happened to me last night. Thanks to an Apple AirTag, I was able to find out I left my keys inside the trunk. It was still a messy situation, but it would have been a much bigger problem without it. If you want in on this added peace of mind, the Apple AirTag 4-pack is at a record-low price right now! Buy the Apple AirTag 4-pack for just $64.99 ($34.01 off)

items.title: Androidâ€™s new flashlight brightness slider now has a clever design like a real flashlight
items.summary: The new 2510 Android Canary release brings a brand new UI for the flashlight brightness controls in Quick Settings.
items.body: TL;DR A future Android update will add a native flashlight brightness slider to the Quick Settings on Pixel phones. The latest Android Canary release introduces a new visual design for this slider that resembles an actual flashlight. This feature is not expected to launch in a stable release until the Android 16 QPR3 update next March. Most Android phones have rear LEDs that can be used as a flashlight, but not all of them let you natively control the brightness. On Pixel phones , for instance, adjusting the flashlight brightness requires a third-party app. This is a hassle, and many users arenâ€™t even aware such apps exist, leaving them unable to change their flashlightâ€™s intensity. A future Android release will finally let you adjust your Pixel phoneâ€™s flashlight strength from Quick Settings . Instead of a simple toggle, the Flashlight tile is being updated to be expandable, revealing a slider to control the flashlightâ€™s intensity. While this slider had a barebones design in the 2508 Android Canary release , Google is now giving it a more striking visual update.

items.title: ChatGPT Atlas is ready to throw down in the AI browser wars
items.summary: Atlas brings powerful ChatGPT tools right to the browser tabs of your desktop â€” and soon, phone.
items.body: TL;DR OpenAI is introducing its first dedicated web browser: ChatGPT Atlas. ChatGPT Atlas will allow users to feed their browsing history into AI queries. An agentic mode is available in preview for Plus, Pro, and Business users. As entrepreneurs seek to find a home for AI in every nook and cranny of our lives, one area weâ€™ve seen receiving concerted attention has been our web browsers. While weâ€™ve long been able to access advanced AI chatbot through their web portals, this new effort seeks to bring AI processing power right to the browser itself, opening up new use cases. Maybe that means AI agents being able to interact with remote websites just as if we were doing so ourselves, or concisely breaking down complicated pages and summarizing them for us . Now one of the biggest names in the industry is taking its own stab at just this kind of project. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: South Africa knock Pakistan out of World Cup in rain-hit match
items.summary: South Africa secure a 150-run victory via the DLS method to knock Pakistan out of the ICC Women's World Cup and return to the top of the table in a rain-plagued fixture in Colombo.

items.title: The BOOX Palma 2 Pro brings color E Ink and 5G to a pocket-sized e-reader
items.summary: The Note Air5 C also arrives as Android 15 comes to BOOXâ€™s latest lineup.
items.body: Credit: BOOX TL;DR BOOX just launched the Palma 2 Pro and Note Air5 C in the US and EU. Both feature color E Ink displays and Android 15. The Palma 2 Pro adds 5G in a pocket-sized design. After launching the P6 Pro series in China earlier this month, BOOX has now brought its high-end counterpart to a global audience. The new Palma 2 Pro brings the same blend of color E Ink and 5G connectivity to the US and Europe, launching alongside the larger Note Air5 C tablet. Both devices run Android 15 and continue BOOXâ€™s effort to combine the comfort of paper with the flexibility of a smart device. We got an early look at the Palma 2 Pro during IFA 2025 in Berlin , where it already hinted at many of the same upgrades seen in the P6 Pro. The 6.13-inch handheld swaps the usual black-and-white E Ink display for a Kaleido 3 color panel, which delivers 300 ppi for monochrome content and 150 ppi for color. It also features 5G support via a hybrid SIM and microSD slot, marking a first for the Palma lineup. Powered by Android 15 with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage, it keeps the textured, water-repellent design that made the earlier Palma 2 such a hit.

items.title: Samsung pauses One UI 8 rollout across multiple Galaxy S generations
items.summary: Several Samsung phones have had their One UI 8 updates put on hold.
items.body: TL;DR Distribution of One UI 8 to the Galaxy S23 series has reportedly paused weeks after it first began. The S23 follows the S22 and S24 in having a bumpy One UI 8 rollout. Samsung hasnâ€™t shared when we should expect the update to resume. Samsungâ€™s in the process of rolling out the Android 16-based One UI 8 across its wide range of compatible phones. The update started hitting the Galaxy S23 just a couple of weeks ago â€” but now, Samsung has halted that distribution. As reported by SammyGuru , Galaxy S23 phones arenâ€™t currently able to download One UI 8. The S23 series is just the latest to have its One UI 8 rollout stopped: The S24 and S22 series both had the plug pulled on their respective rollouts, too (though SammyGuru says the S22â€™s update is â€œpartially resumedâ€).

items.title: Googleâ€™s Android app is finally catching up to the iOS app with one crucial feature
items.summary: Many years after iOS, the Google app on Android is finally getting an incognito search option.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google is working on adding a new incognito search mode to its Android app. The feature will work by turning off the history for your current search. This is the equivalent of Googleâ€™s incognito mode on its iOS app. There are many ways to perform an incognito search on your Android phone, but Google is working on adding another one that is both more intuitive and easier to remember. The option might have the less obvious name of â€œHistory Off Searchâ€ instead of a simpler â€œIncognitoâ€ and will appear straight in the main Google app. This will finally allow the Google app on Android to catch up to the iOS app, which has had an incognito mode for many years. items.title: This 6-pound phone case wants to cure your screen addiction â€” with pain
items.summary: Screen-time control through sheer physical discomfort.
items.body: Credit: Kickstarter TL;DR A Kickstarter campaign wants to curb screen addiction with a six-pound stainless steel phone case. The 6-Pound Phone Case is intentionally heavy, pocket-unfriendly, and screwed together. Matter Neuroscience says the weight creates a physical feedback loop that helps reduce screen time. Many of us have tried to spend less time on our phones . You might have tried to hide your device in another room, use app timers, or let Androidâ€™s Bedtime mode turn the screen gray when itâ€™s time to wind down. Some of you may have even bought a timed lock box to physically prevent you from accessing your handset during certain parts of the day. If youâ€™ve tried all that and still find yourself doom scrolling, one Kickstarter campaign thinks itâ€™s time for a different approach â€” specifically, a more physically painful one.

Streams will be up on Samsungâ€™s website and YouTube channel, and weâ€™ve also got it embedded right here. Apple launched its Vision Pro over two years ago, and while the companyâ€™s mixed-reality headset has had a few bumps along the way, that still represents a big lead it has over anything similar for Androidâ€™s ecosystem. But now itâ€™s finally time to start catching up, and after its own series of seemingly interminable teasers, weâ€™re ready to enter the era of Android XR with Samsung formally introducing its Galaxy XR headset. items.title: This new flagship might be the cheapest phone with a 200MP tele camera
items.summary: History tells us it'll see a big price hike in global markets, though.
items.body: Credit: Realme TL;DR Realme has launched the GT8 Pro in China today. This might be the cheapest phone with a 200MP telephoto camera, starting at ~$560 in China. The device will likely see a huge price increase in Europe. Vivo debuted a 200MP telephoto camera last year, and weâ€™ve since seen a host of camera phones with this feature in 2025. Now, realme has announced the GT8 Pro, and it might be the cheapest phone with a 200MP tele camera. The realme GT8 Pro indeed offers a 200MP 3x periscope camera (f/2.6, Isocell HP5, 1/1.56-inch) that supports 6x lossless resolution zoom and 25cm macro focusing. The rest of the camera system consists of a 50MP main camera (1/1.56-inch), a 50MP ultrawide shooter, and a 32MP selfie camera. In a neat touch, you can swap out the rear camera housings. So, if you fancy a circular housing, a square bump, or a robot-like housing, you can screw those on. Realme also said it will offer schematics so you can 3D-print your own housings.

items.title: Google Messages is making it easier to share from your Google Photos library
items.summary: Google Messages is testing a new media gallery UI that embeds Androidâ€™s Photo Picker.
items.body: TL;DR A Google Messages update will integrate your cloud photos and videos directly into the main media picker. This is powered by a new Android feature that lets apps embed the systemâ€™s photo picker experience. The change removes the extra tap needed to access your cloud library and improves security by no longer requiring broad gallery permissions. Google Messages makes it easy to share photos and videos from your phone, but accessing your cloud library isnâ€™t as seamless as it could be. Currently, tapping the gallery button opens a media picker showing your most recent locally stored images. To access your Google Photos library, you need to tap the â€œFoldersâ€ button â€” an extra, slightly inconvenient step. Fortunately, an upcoming Google Messages update will integrate your cloud photos and videos directly into the main media picker, removing that extra step entirely. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Iâ€™d pay more for YouTube Premium if it added these 5 features
items.summary: If YouTube wants my money, it needs to give me more control over my experience.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Iâ€™ve been a YouTube Premium subscriber for many years now, ever since the Premium Family plan became available in Lebanon when I was living there. Other subscriptions have come and gone in that time, but not YouTube; itâ€™s the one monthly payment I gladly make because I know it supports creators I like and saves me hours of frustration with endless ads on every device my husband and I own. But YouTube Premium isnâ€™t perfect. Every few months, Iâ€™ll hear about a new experiment or new feature exclusive to Premium users , and think, â€œGah, this isnâ€™t what I want!â€ If it were up to me, YouTube would add more robust controls and customizations and offer them to Premium subscribers, instead of wasting time reinventing the wheel with a new comment page look or silly autoplay and Shorts hooks. Specifically, there are five features I wish YouTube would add that Iâ€™d be willing to pay more for. Here they are.

items.title: These are the questions I ask myself before buying a new phone
items.summary: They help narrow down my options and prevent my emotions from taking the wheel.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority I consider myself a smart consumer, and when the time comes to upgrade to a new phone , I like to plan things out. Iâ€™m not an impulse buyer, and I try not to get caught up in all the marketing mumbo jumbo or the latest and greatest that may be overkill for me. What I do is ask myself a series of questions that help me pick the right phone â€” with the right specs, at the right price, and at the right time. This makes me feel like Iâ€™m in control of the entire process instead of being swayed by emotion, which, in my opinion, is usually a recipe for disaster.

items.title: Google is selling refurb Pixel 8 phones for $489 â€” but is it worth it?

The Pixel 9a or a Pixel 9 or 9 Pro XL (if discounted) may be a better bargain, depending on your priorities. Google started selling refurbished Pixel phones about a year ago , starting with the Pixel 6 and Pixel 7. A few weeks ago, it dropped the aging Pixel 6 â€” currently guaranteed OS updates through October 2026 â€” from the rotation. Now, Googleâ€™s added a newer old phone to its refurb offerings: the Pixel 8 is back on the Google Store, starting at $489. 9to5Google spotted today that the Pixel 8 and Pixel 8 Pro have joined the Pixel 7, Pixel 7 Pro, and Pixel 7a on Googleâ€™s Certified Refurbished storefront. The 128-gig Pixel 8 goes for $489, down from its $699 MSRP; the 256-gig model is $539. And Geminiâ€™s capabilities in Sheets continue to grow, as it received an update last week that allows it to handle more complex, multi-stage edits . items.title: Googleâ€™s Pixel 10 can now run Linux apps better than other Android phones
items.summary: Unlike other Android phones, the Pixel 10 supports GPU-accelerated rendering for Linux apps in Android 16 QPR2.
items.body: TL;DR Google is adding GPU acceleration for graphical Linux apps to Androidâ€™s Terminal app, but the feature is currently exclusive to the Pixel 10. This feature relies on Gfxstream, a library that forwards graphics API calls from the guest Linux virtual machine to the host Android deviceâ€™s GPU for accelerated rendering. Though the feature is live for Pixel 10 users in Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3, itâ€™s still buggy and doesnâ€™t yet offer the near-native performance expected. Back in March, Google introduced the Linux Terminal app to Android, which uses virtualization to run full-fledged Linux programs on Android devices. While the initial release only supported command-line apps, Google is addressing that limitation in the upcoming Android 16 QPR2 update. Even though Android 16 QPR2 will add support for graphical desktop Linux apps , they will run poorly on most Android devices. This is because the Linux Terminal app currently relies on a software-based renderer called Lavapipe. Lavapipe uses the deviceâ€™s CPU for complex calculations and rasterization (the process of converting vector graphics into pixels) â€” tasks that the deviceâ€™s GPU can perform much more quickly and efficiently.

items.title: Qualcommâ€™s new Snapdragon chip misses out on one of Android 16â€™s best features
items.summary: The Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 doesnâ€™t support Androidâ€™s Linux Terminal, making Qualcomm the only vendor to not support it.
items.body: TL;DR Qualcommâ€™s powerful new Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip unfortunately doesnâ€™t support Androidâ€™s new Linux Terminal feature. This is because the feature requires support for â€œnon-protectedâ€ virtual machines, which Qualcommâ€™s latest high-end chip does not offer. As a result, users wanting to run desktop Linux apps on Android must currently use a device with a Google, MediaTek, or Samsung chip. When Qualcomm unveiled its new Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 last month, the question on most peopleâ€™s minds was: â€œHow well does it perform?â€ The answer, it turns out, is incredibly well â€” at least in benchmarks . Qualcomm has always done a great job at building powerful, yet efficient, mobile processors, but itâ€™s hard to find real-world tasks that can really push those processors to their limits. Thatâ€™s because most Android apps are built for the lowest common denominator â€” cheap devices with vastly slower processors than flagship phones. On the other hand, many Linux apps are built for people with powerful workstations, as Linux is popular among power users and developers.

items.title: Amazon admits its color Kindles arenâ€™t the best option for bookworms (Updated: Amazon response)
items.summary: Amazon had indicated that black-and-white Kindle models deliver a sharper reading experience, but has since clarified this.
items.body: Credit: Amazon TL;DR Amazon updated its Kindle Colorsoft FAQs with a candid disclaimer. The company says that black-and-white Kindles, like the Paperwhite, offer crisper text. Colorsoft screens still suit comics and PDFs, but trade sharpness for color. Update: October 20, 2025 (12:25 PM ET): Following the publication of the original article below, Amazon contacted us to highlight an amendment to the FAQ section on the Kindle Scribe Colorsoft. In response to the question â€œHow is the reading experience different on Kindle Colorsoft than on Kindle Paperwhite?â€ the answer now reads â€œThe Colorsoft display is distinct from the Paperwhite display, and includes a fully optimized display stack to deliver high quality color reading. The black and white resolution (300ppi) is the same across devices.â€ Itâ€™s an understandable change. While the original intention of the company might have been to honestly outline the optimizations of each device, signposting a different Kindle for reading black and white text could be construed by some as an indication that the Colorsoft is lacking in this regard. The new FAQ answer removes this part to avoid such confusion and makes clear that the resolution oâ€¦

Smart ring maker Oura introduced stress tracking to its platform in 2023. Today, the company announced that itâ€™s building on these shorter-term stress features with an upcoming tool thatâ€™s meant to give you insight into how your body is handling stress over time. Ouraâ€™s also taking the first steps to develop features thatâ€™ll warn users when their blood pressure may be creeping up. In a press release , Oura detailed a busy end to the year. Over the next few weeks, Oura will be rolling out a new Cumulative Stress feature, improvements to its Cycle Insights, and a major update to its app. Itâ€™s also kicking off a study to develop a feature itâ€™s calling Blood Pressure Profile, which combine trends measured by Oura Ring wearables with questionnaire responses to give users a rough idea of whether their blood pressure may be cause for concern.

items.title: The Samsung Galaxy S25 FE is a good upgrade for anyone but newer FE owners

It was a genuine flagship-tier Android phone that didnâ€™t break the bank. Iâ€™ve long felt like subsequent releases have failed to live up to that initial device, as the Galaxy maker chose penny-pinching conservatism over a truly exciting product. Samsung has recently released the Galaxy S25 FE (), and Iâ€™ve spent just over two weeks with it. The good news is that the company is stepping up its game with a couple of long-overdue upgrades. items.body: TL;DR The ANBERNIC RG DS is a new dual-screen handheld with a DS Lite form factor. A new video showcases not just Nintendo DS emulation, but also lightweight 3DS emulation. Details are still slim, but it will retail for less than $100. ANBERNIC has put out some very interesting Android gaming handhelds this year, like the PSP Go-inspired RG Slide , but the RG DS takes the cake. In a year thatâ€™s largely been defined by expensive dual-screen handhelds like the AYANEO Pocket DS and AYN Thor , this device finally brings the price below $100. A new video uploaded over the weekend finally shows the device in action, and despite the affordable price, it looks like it will be capable of much more than just DS games. The video shows off gameplay in two 3DS games: Rune Factory 4 and Shovel Knight. The former had some minor audio tearing, but otherwise gameplay seemed smooth.

items.title: This new â€˜Liteâ€™ PC emulator removes sketchy permissions and trackers
items.summary: GameHub has no shortage of trackers, analytics, and heavy-handed permissions, but GameHub Lite is to the rescue.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR GameHub Lite has been released as an alternative to the GameHub PC emulator for Android. This is a reverse-engineered project that strips away GameHubâ€™s trackers and extensive permissions. Controller brand GameSir launched the GameHub app early this year, allowing you to run PC games directly on your Android phone without an internet connection. There have been some privacy concerns about this app, but an enterprising developer has launched GameHub Lite to assuage these concerns. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Itâ€™s been 5 months since I left T-Mobile, and I have no regrets
items.summary: I'd say I made the right call.
items.body: Earlier this year, I made a pretty drastic change in mobile carriers. After 10 years of being subscribed to T-Mobile , I decided it was time to call it quits and switch to a different provider. I moved not only myself, but also my partner and some of my family members to Visible, and thatâ€™s where weâ€™ve been ever since. Fast forward to today, and itâ€™s officially been over five months since T-Mobile and I parted ways. Now that the honeymoon phase with Visible is over and Iâ€™ve had time to really assess things, whatâ€™s my conclusion? Was the switch worth it?

items.title: Sri Lanka's Gunaratne trapped lbw first ball
items.summary: Sri Lanka's Vishmi Gunaratne is trapped lbw by Bangladesh's Marufa Akter on the first ball of their match in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

items.title: One of the best Android Auto dongles now plays nice with Apple CarPlay
items.summary: One adapter, two platforms, zero cables.
items.body: TL;DR The AAWireless Two Plus just launched, adding Apple CarPlay support to the popular Android Auto adapter. It offers quick setup, easy phone switching, and automatic reconnection when you return to the car. The device is available now in the US and EU, with a UK launch coming soon. The startup behind one of our favorite Android Auto dongles has launched a new model that finally works for both major phone ecosystems. The new AAWireless Two Plus adapter brings wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay connectivity to cars that only support wired connections.

items.title: What would Dyche bring to Forest?
items.summary: Match of the Day's Mark Chapman, Troy Deeney and Shay Given discuss what former Burnley and Everton boss Sean Dyche might bring to struggling Nottingham Forest.

items.title: A ton of services are down or facing issues right now (Update: Fixes applied)
items.summary: Update: Services affected by AWS issues should be coming back online now.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Users on a variety of websites and services are reporting outages and connectivity issues today. Affected services include Snapchat, Grammarly, Prime Video, Signal, Asana, and Slack. AWS has confirmed an issue and that itâ€™s applied fixes for the problem. Update: October 20, 2025 (5:30 AM ET): Amazon has updated its AWS dashboard to confirm that it has applied fixes for the issue. The firm said it applied â€œinitial mitigationsâ€ and noticed early signs of a recovery. â€œWe are seeing significant signs of recovery. Most requests should now be succeeding. We continue to work through a backlog of queued requests. We will continue to provide additional information,â€ the company added in a subsequent update.

items.title: Is Reddit not working? Here are some fixes you can try!
items.summary: Here's some tips to get Reddit up and running again.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Itâ€™s nowhere close to Google, YouTube, or Facebook, but Reddit stays firm on the list of the most popular websites in the world. The network covers pretty much any subject, and has a strong following. The community is known for its loyalty, so we can understand how frustrating it can be when you have problems with Reddit not working. This rarely happens, so it might come as a shock. An outage is often the cause, but it could also be an external problem. Hereâ€™s a quick guide on how to fix any issues you might experience.

items.title: I wish Google didnâ€™t make smartphones
items.summary: Pixel is good for Google, but not for Android.
items.body: While I always welcome more competition in the Android smartphone market, one key player I havenâ€™t been so happy about is Google. At first, I was interested to see what Google could do and the potential that more stock Android smartphones could offer. But over time, that interest has turned into concern â€” to the point that I actually wish Google didnâ€™t make smartphones. This isnâ€™t due to the hardware itself or even Google as a company, but rather Googleâ€™s position as the primary developer of Android.

items.title: Gemini for TV appears on another new device, and itâ€™s still not the Google TV Streamer
items.summary: Gemini creeps its way onto another Google TV set.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A user has encountered a setup screen Gemini for Google TV on their Sony Bravia TV. The screen appeared after they updated their Google TV Home app. This is the first instance of Gemini for TV running on a device beyond TCLâ€™s premier televisions. Thereâ€™s still no word on when Gemini for TV will roll out to Googleâ€™s own devices. In September, Google began rolling out Gemini to Google TV products, as promised in May, but initially, only one device received the next-generation assistant. Now, it seems that support for additional devices may be imminent. A Reddit user, u/Proshis_Saha_Swopna , discovered the Gemini setup screen on their Sony Bravia TV running Android TV 14 after updating the Google TV Home app via the Play Store.

items.title: Goal of the season contender? MOTD pundits on 'world-class' Buendia
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit and ex-Aston Villa goalkeeper Shay Given describes Emiliano Buendia's winning goal in Villa's 2-1 win over Tottenham in the Premier League as "world class".

items.title: The ultimate Ashes competitor - Broad on walking, Warner and that final wicket
items.summary: In the first of a new series of From the Ashes, Stuart Broad reflects on his legendary career, including battles with David Warner, his 8-15 and fairytale farewell.

items.title: Villa fight back to win at Tottenham
items.summary: Aston Villa fight back from a goal down to beat Spurs 2-1 at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

items.title: Maguire heads Man Utd to victory against Liverpool
items.summary: Harry Maguire heads Manchester United to a 2-1 win against Liverpool - their first victory at Anfield since 2016.

items.title: I brought Nova Launcherâ€™s best feature to my new launcher, but I donâ€™t think you should
items.summary: Three years since its last update, Sesame is no longer at the peak of its power.
items.body: Saying that Nova Launcher had a profound impact on the Android we know and love today would be an understatement. The launcher endured over a dozen operating system versions and opened up a universe of customization to users. Not only that, it also made app search and discovery a huge part of its functionality, forcing competing launchers to up their game. These smarts are largely thanks to Sesame Shortcuts . Although Nova Launcherâ€™s death knell has already sounded, my recent thoughts have turned to Sesame Shortcutsâ€™ dim future. But, for now at least, you can still integrate the powerful search app in your new Android launcher. Hereâ€™s how to do it, why you might want to think twice about it, and what you should consider before doing it.

items.title: 5 ways the Galaxy Z Fold 7 beats the Pixel 10 Pro Fold
items.summary: One is the future, the other is history repeating itself.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority Itâ€™s been an exciting year for foldable phones, thanks largely to the Galaxy Z Fold 7 . Itâ€™s a phone I havenâ€™t been able to put down since launch. Itâ€™s not my daily driver, but itâ€™s become my go-to work phone, the one that always draws a few too many stares for my liking. This is the year Samsung reclaimed mastery over the form factor and reminded everyone that foldables arenâ€™t a fad, theyâ€™re the future.

items.title: I tried Apple SharePlay, and now Googleâ€™s version feels like a beta test
items.summary: Google has a LOT of work to do.
items.body: SharePlay isnâ€™t new. Itâ€™s been around on Apple devices for a few years now, allowing you to team up with friends or family to watch something together, syncing video streams over a video call. Itâ€™s a handy tool when your loved ones arenâ€™t in the same location. As with everything Apple, you canâ€™t use it outside of the walled garden, so Android users are left out. To counter that, Google made its own version of SharePlay (I donâ€™t blame you if youâ€™ve never heard of it), but it leaves you wanting more â€” much more. After a moment of using it, I thought, â€œThatâ€™s it? Thatâ€™s all it does?â€

items.title: These 6 lesser-known free apps make my life easier
items.summary: Sometimes, focused is better.
items.body: For a while, I wanted to keep my phone as streamlined as possible, only keeping my essential apps installed. But this year has been a tough one and keeping track of everything mentally has been getting more difficult to do. I decided to start leaning on some niche apps, while not adding on additional subscriptions, to help me keep track of everything. Overall, it has proven to be a positive change. While not every app Iâ€™ve tried has been a hit, these six have proven to be hidden gems that make my life easier.

items.title: Whatever you do, donâ€™t buy these 6 Google gadgets right now
items.summary: The stinkers of the Google Store.
items.body: As the weather gets colder and the days get shorter, that can only mean one thing: fall is officially here. Not only is this the time for pumpkin spice lattes and haunted houses, but thereâ€™s also a good chance youâ€™re starting to think about your upcoming holiday shopping. And if youâ€™re an Android fan, youâ€™re probably going to do some of that shopping on the Google Store. Front and center on the Google Store today are all of Googleâ€™s latest releases â€” including the Pixel 10 , Pixel 10 Pro , Pixel Watch 4 , and the shockingly good Pixel Buds 2a . Theyâ€™re the best of what Google has to offer, and theyâ€™re likely what youâ€™re visiting the Google Store for.

items.title: Amazon says the Kindle Colorsoft isnâ€™t great for reading books, and I agree
items.summary: Color me unsurprised.
items.body: Amazon rarely undercuts its own products, but when the company quietly slipped a caveat into the FAQ for its new Colorsoft Kindle , it made one thing abundantly clear: if you care about crisp, black-and-white reading, buy something else. As someone who still acts like theyâ€™ll earn a pizza party if they read enough books, I spend a lot of time with my Kindle. Amazonâ€™s honest take doesnâ€™t surprise me (and wonâ€™t surprise anyone whoâ€™s read on both types of e-reader), but itâ€™s a rare day I find myself agreeing with the company about anything. Kindle Colorsoftâ€™s honest fine print

items.title: A new (artificial) era for Google Photos
items.summary: Thanks to AI and XR, Google Photos is entering a new era of content creation - for better or worse.
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZF42Sm4Gq0 This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown dive into a suite of upcoming Google Photos features that could change how we create and remember our favorite moments. They discuss new AI-powered highlight video templates that automate editing, the controversial introduction of face-retouching tools, and the exciting prospect of reliving memories in a 3D spatial environment with a new generation of Android XR headsets. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, weâ€™ll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

items.title: Google is preparing big screen recording upgrades for Android tablets and PCs
items.summary: Google is adding a toolbar, selfie camera capture, and more features to Androidâ€™s screen recorder.
items.body: If you want to share your Android phoneâ€™s screen content, you have a few options: take a screenshot , cast the screen, or record it with the built-in screen recorder. The screen recorder has been around for a couple of years now, but itâ€™s still fairly basic. Despite receiving a few new features in recent years, it lacks many quality-of-life improvements found in other operating systems. Now, in preparation for Android coming to PCs , Google is working on a major upgrade to the feature. Hereâ€™s an early look. Youâ€™re reading the Authority Insights Newsletter , a weekly newsletter that reveals some new facet of Android that hasnâ€™t been reported on anywhere else. If youâ€™re looking for the latest scoops, the hottest leaks, and breaking news on Googleâ€™s Android operating system and other mobile tech topics, then weâ€™ve got you covered.

items.title: Iâ€™m a Pixel and foldable fan, but the Pixel 10 Pro Fold isnâ€™t for me
items.summary: How badly do you want a foldable Pixel?
items.body: The Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold is a very good foldable. Itâ€™s the first folding phone with an IP68 rating and built-in magnetic charging. Staples like a good hinge, reliable battery life, quality screens, and well-made software are all present. By all of those accounts, the Pixel 10 Pro Fold should be an easy recommendation. And yet, I think itâ€™s the most challenging model to recommend out of the entire Pixel 10 series.

items.title: Itâ€™s the little things: 4 quality-of-life updates I want to see in Gemini
items.summary: The AI chatbot can be vastly improved with minimal effort.
items.body: Credit: Megan Ellis / Android Authority Gemini is one of my favorite apps, but thereâ€™s definitely room for improvement. I want to see changes, but Iâ€™m not talking about anything super substantial here. Sure, we all want tools like Gemini to be faster, more engaging, and 100% factual, but thatâ€™s not the point of this post. I want to highlight a few smaller changes that I personally want to see that would drastically elevate the experience with Googleâ€™s AI chatbot. Donâ€™t be weird, Gemini

items.title: This Android launcher goes all in on widgets, and I absolutely love it
items.summary: I came from Niagara and Iâ€™m not sure I want to go back.
items.body: Iâ€™ve used almost every major Android launcher in recent years, some for a few days for testing purposes and others for years as the backbone of my smartphoneâ€™s home screen. These launchers range from the now-deprecated Nova Launcher to hot new properties like Octopi Launcher . Through it all, Iâ€™ve settled on Niagara Launcher thanks to its minimalist, productivity-focused design, which Iâ€™ve thoughtfully integrated into my daily workflow. However, as readers know, Iâ€™m always ready to reevaluate my choices and consider better alternatives. Today, Iâ€™m exploring AIO Launcher . Although Iâ€™ve seen many users recommend this app across various online forums, I havenâ€™t spent much time exploring all its features. And wow, thereâ€™s a lot to uncover here. Not a smooth transition At its core, AIO Launcher is unlike any other home screen on the market. Itâ€™s decidedly different from traditional products like Nova Launcher and Smart Launcher, but I canâ€™t quite compare it to other niche launchers. The best way to describe it is as an amalgamation of Kvaesitsoâ€™s endless scrolling home screen and Niagara Launcherâ€™s app drawer, but this isnâ€™t a bang-on description.

items.title: Weâ€™ve tested the best phones with an IR blaster, and these are the ones you should buy in 2025
items.summary: These are your best smartphone options if you're in need of an infrared blaster.
items.body: There was a time when smartphones packed everything and the kitchen sink, including headphone jacks, removable batteries, notification LEDs, and IR blasters. While those first three have largely fallen by the wayside, there are a few notable Android smartphones that still include the infrared projector. IR blasters are super useful for controlling other devices, like TVs and audio equipment. Weâ€™ve tested a slew of Android phones in 2025, but only a handful include IR blasters that are worth your time. Iâ€™ve narrowed your choices based on use cases, price points, and unique selling points.

items.title: 3 carriers with international features that rival Google Fi
items.summary: Visible, US Mobile, and Total all offer some advantages over Google Fi. Of course, none of these are perfect.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Google Fi has long been the go-to choice for travelers thanks to its unlimited plans with international roaming and calling perks. In fact, it often outperforms even the most expensive options from the big three postpaid carriers. The downside is that Fiâ€™s â€œunlimitedâ€ data is not truly unlimited, with speeds dropping dramatically after 30 to 100GB of use. Add in premium pricing and a mixed reputation for customer service, and it is clear Google Fi is not perfect. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.summary: AT&T is currently experiencing issues.

It appears the reports began as early as this morning, but now the reports are spiking. Update: October 17, 2025 (7:58 PM ET): After a brief outage, it appears that AT&Tâ€™s network is starting to return to normal. Original article: October 17, 2025 (5:17 PM ET): If youâ€™re an AT&T customer and youâ€™re having trouble with the service, youâ€™re not alone. A growing number of users are reporting that the network is experiencing an outage.

items.title: Google Play spills the beans on what apps and games are coming to Android XR
items.summary: The Galaxy XR may not be out yet, but the Play Store isn't waiting around.
items.body: TL;DR A new Play Store section highlights apps and games built for Android XR. Titles spotted include Asteroid, Vacation Simulator, and NFL Pro Era. Virtual Desktop has also appeared, hinting at PCVR streaming support for the platform. The big Galaxy XR headset reveal is just around the corner, but Google seems unconcerned about syncing everything perfectly with Samsungâ€™s timing. A section on the Play Store has popped up showcasing â€œimmersive experiences made for your XR headset,â€ giving us a decent idea of whatâ€™s on the way for Android XR. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: The next version of Google Gemini could be just around the corner (Update: Maybe not?)
items.summary: An announcement could happen in the very near future.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A leak may have revealed when Google plans to launch Gemini 3.0. The leak suggests weâ€™ll get an announcement on Oct 22, 2025. Update, October 17, 2025 (05:16 PM ET): It hasnâ€™t even been a week yet since we looked at this possible leak into a Gemini 3.0 ETA, and now a new source is throwing just a lot of cold water on those claims. The site Sources reports that contrary to what we just heard, Google will stick with the same December launch for Gemini 3.0 that it used for Gemini 2.0 and Gemini 1.0 before it.

items.title: That weird camera gimbal â€˜Robot Phoneâ€™ might actually go up for sale next year
items.summary: The hardware could be a lot further along than its AI-looking video suggested.
items.body: TL;DR Earlier this week, HONOR teased a phone with a unique camera gimbal arm. While the company said weâ€™d see more at MWC, the very AI-looking nature of the video left it unclear how far along this project is. A new source claims that work on the prototype is 80% complete. In 2025, telling the difference between whatâ€™s real and whatâ€™s not can feel like a Sisyphean task. Generative AI tools are becoming more sophisticated every day, and while lots of AI content is still easy to spot, who knows how much youâ€™re missing? Earlier this week we checked out one of the most impressive-looking phone hardware teasers weâ€™ve seen in a minute, but was it even real? Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: A Nothing Phone 1 user may have figured out how to get Android 16 on their device
items.summary: The port is reportedly not ready for everyone yet.
items.body: Credit: Oliver Cragg / Android Authority TL;DR A developer claims to have successfully installed Nothing OS 4.0 on a Phone 1. Everything reportedly works, including the new Camera app and its presets. There are a few issues, like the clock in the status bar not being correctly aligned. Although Android 16 has been available on Pixels for a while now, many other Android phones are just now starting to get a taste. For example, Nothing recently rolled out the Nothing OS 4.0 beta , which is based on Android 16. This beta is only available for the Phone 2, Phone 2a, Phone 2a Pro, Phone 3, and eventually the Phone 3a. However, it appears a developer may have found a way to get the OS running on a Phone 1. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: OnePlus tries to show OxygenOS 16 is snappier than One UI, but somethingâ€™s fishy
items.summary: Skill issue.
items.body: TL;DR OnePlus has detailed its upcoming OxygenOS 16 update. A head-to-head comparison with Samsung One UI was meant to show that OnePlusâ€™s software is more respsonsive. Closer viewing shows One UI failed to keep pace largely due to user error. OnePlusâ€™s latest OxygenOS 16 update is set to begin rolling out broadly next month . The update will bring a bunch of new features , including, OnePlus says, enhancements to its Parallel Processing, which is meant to make opening and switching apps feel faster. In a video showcasing the new update, OnePlus compared the app switching experience in OxygenOS to Samsungâ€™s One UI â€” but the demo seemed intentionally dishonest. As flagged by uyagoda_ on Threads, a split-screen pitting OxygenOS 16 against Samsung One UI (labeled â€œOther Flagship UIâ€) appears to show a Samsung phone hanging as a game loads while the OnePlus phone next to it continued to fly through cycling in and out of various apps. At a glance, it looks bad for Samsung, but on closer inspection, the One UI hiccup was pretty clearly user error.

items.title: Galaxy S26 Edge out, S26 Plus in: Listing suggests Samsung lineup reversal
items.summary: This is the latest evidence that the Plus is still alive.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR The Samsung Galaxy S26 Plus has appeared in a listing on the IMEI database. According to the listing, the phone carries the model number SM-S947B. A rumor claims the Galaxy S26 series will launch in March 2026. Rumors and leaks have been swirling around the Galaxy S26 series. Some of the most interesting of which regard the Galaxy S26 Plus and Galaxy S26 Edge. At first, we heard that Samsung may replace the Plus with the Edge. Now the pendulum is swinging the other way, as weâ€™re now hearing that the Plus may be safe and the Edge may be out. Lending further credence to the Plus making its return, the model has been spotted on a database. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Maps might finally let you personalize your vehicle before hitting the road
items.summary: Changing your car icon when youâ€™re not meant to be focused on driving makes sense.
items.body: TL;DR In the latest Google Maps build, we managed to enable a setting that lets you choose your Driving avatar in the settings menu. Right now, you can only change the icon from the navigation screen. Choosing it before setting off would mean you can give the road your full focus. Google Maps already lets you swap that little blue arrow for something that feels a bit more like your own ride, whether thatâ€™s a sporty hatchback or a pickup truck. The catch is that you can only do it once navigation has started. However, weâ€™ve unearthed clues that this might be about to change. You may unsubscribe at any time. As it stands, once on the route navigation screen, you can change the icon representing your location by tapping on the blue arrow to bring up the menu of avatars on offer. You can get to the same selection by pulâ€¦

items.title: These Google Maps search-along-route changes are one step forward, and one step back
items.summary: Maps is working on new filters for destinations you add to a route.
items.body: TL;DR Google Maps may be considering a change to its interface for adding stops to a route. Instead of seeing options on the map, you could choose them from a list, and also filter those results. The new filters also appear to be in the works for Maps on Android Auto. Plans change, but when they do, Google Maps is ready to roll with the punches. Even if weâ€™re already in the middle of a journey, Maps makes it easy to search for new destinations along our route, and add them as new stops in just a couple taps. While that works great, Google has never been one to leave well enough alone, and weâ€™ve spotted the companyâ€™s developers working on what looks like a new approach to how we add destinations like that. items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.
